text:
How do I step back one word in bash?
In Bash, you can move the cursor back one word using either of these keyboard shortcuts:

1. Alt + B (backward one word)
2. Esc + B (press Esc, release, then press B)

You can also move forward one word using:
1. Alt + F (forward one word)
2. Esc + F (press Esc, release, then press F)

These are standard readline shortcuts in Bash and work in most command-line environments.
